document.heading: Zoning - Modifications to Research and Development Facility Use
An Ordinance Concerning Zoning - Modifications to Research and Development Facility Use

para.heading: In general.
para.text: "Research and development facility" means an establishment where research and development activities are conducted in various disciplines, including biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, medical instrumentation or supplies, communication and information technology, electronics and instrumentation, and computer hardware and software.

para.heading: Inclusions.
para.text: "Research and development facility" includes, as an accessory use, the manufacture, fabrication, processing, or sale of products developed on the same lot as the establishment.

para.heading: Exclusions.
para.text: "Research and development facility" does not include the manufacture, fabrication, processing, or sale of products as a primary use.
All processing, fabrication, assembly, treatment, and packaging of products must be contained indoors entirely within a research and development facility.
Noise, odor, smoke, heat, glare, and vibration resulting from the manufacturing process must be confined to a research and development facility or otherwise minimized.

para.heading: Traffic generation - Truck traffic.
para.text: Only minimal truck traffic required for the daily operations of a research and development facility is permitted.

para.heading: Minimum parcel size – C-2 zoning district.
para.text: In the C-2 zoning district a minimum parcel size of at least 1 acre is required.

attachment.heading: Commercial Districts – Permitted and Conditional Uses

tr.td: Entertainment: Live (Accessory to Restaurant, Tavern, Art Studio, or Art Gallery)
Motor Vehicle Rental Establishment (Fully Enclosed Structure)
Motor Vehicle Rental Establishment (Outdoor Vehicle Display)
Motor Vehicle Service and Repair: Major
Motor Vehicle Service and Repair: Minor (Fully Enclosed Structure)
Motor Vehicle Service and Repair: Minor (Outdoor Vehicle Storage)
Retail Goods Establishment (No Alcoholic Beverages Sales)
Retail Goods Establishment (With Alcoholic Beverages Sales)

td.p: 1 Allowed only in a structure lawfully existing as of June 5, 2017.
2 However, along Pratt Street in the C-5 District, principal-use parking garages are prohibited. See § 10-503(c)(1).
3 Only telecommunications base stations that comply with the stealth design standards of § 14-338 are considered permitted uses.
4 Only Wireless Communication Services that are modifications to – and do not substantially change the physical dimension of – an existing telecommunications facility, are considered permitted uses.

5 Under § 14-329(a)(1) and (a)(2), both outdoor dining and rooftop dining, respectively, require approval as a conditional use by the Board of Municipal and Zoning Appeals if located in a C-1, C-1-E, C-1-VC, or C-2 zoning district .

attachment.heading: Industrial Districts – Permitted and Conditional Uses

tr.td: Entertainment: Live (Accessory to Restaurant, Tavern, Art Studio, or Art Gallery)
Motor Vehicle Service and Repair: Major
Motor Vehicle Service and Repair: Minor
Retail Goods Establishment (No Alcoholic Beverages Sales)
Retail Goods Establishment (With Alcoholic Beverages Sales)

td.p: 1 Allowed only when (i) accessory to an office structure, research and development facility, or industrial use, and (ii) integrated into that structure, facility, or use to serve its employees.
2 Allowed only when secondary to a primary industrial use.
3 Office uses legally established as of the effective date of this Code are deemed conforming and are not required to be secondary to a primary industrial use.
4 Only telecommunications base stations that comply with the stealth design standards of § 14-338 are considered permitted uses.
5 Only Wireless Communication Services that are modifications to – and do not substantially change the physical dimension of – an existing telecommunications facility, are considered permitted uses.

attachment.heading: Transit-Oriented Development Districts – Permitted and Conditional Uses

tr.td: Retail Goods Establishment (No Alcoholic Beverages Sales)
Retail Goods Establishment (With Alcoholic Beverages Sales)
Electric Substation: Enclosed, Indoor, or Outdoor

td.p: 1 No recreation facilities are allowed, except for standard playground equipment and outdoor furniture.
2 Not to exceed 5,000 sq. ft. of the structure's gross floor area.
3 Only telecommunications base stations that comply with the stealth design standards of § 14-338 are considered permitted uses.
4 Only Wireless Communication Services that are modifications to – and do not substantially change the physical dimension of – an existing telecommunications facility, are considered permitted uses.
